professional_experience.title: Senior Full-Stack Software Developer
responsibilities: Develop and maintain the new OTA platform using Django with Python and Django REST Framework (DRF).
Integrate APIs from hotel providers like Omnibees, payment APIs like PagBank, and the consolidating airline booking API Envision.

Assist in creating and developing the new R&D area, applying agile methodologies (Scrum and Kanban), managing and prioritizing tasks for other developers, establishing development standards, applying clean code principles, and designing software architecture.

professional_experience.title: Full-Stack Software Engineer
responsibilities: Developed cryptocurrency projects using Django REST Framework in Python, including a Proof of Concept (POC) for a BRL stablecoin for the largest bank in Latin America, in collaboration with Mercado Bitcoin and Bacen.
Worked on a Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) for Bank Indonesia in partnership with ANZ (Australia and New Zealand Banking Group). Both projects utilized the Stellar network.

Contributed to front-end development projects such as ReawardsApp, a lottery app built with React Native, and a corporate website developed using Gatsby.js, focusing on intuitive and responsive user interfaces.

Implemented agile development practices, utilizing methodologies like Scrum and Kanban, and adopted CI/CD, clean code principles, and thorough documentation to ensure code quality and maintainability.

Big Mind Assistant is a Telegram bot focused on accessibility, designed to help users interact in a more inclusive way. It allows audio messages to be transcribed into text, images to be described, and text to be converted into speech, making information more accessible for individuals with reading difficulties or visual impairments. It's ideal for enhancing communication and accessibility, especially for Portuguese-speaking users.

projects.description: Nomi-Nomi is a React Native app that serves as an interface for the backend of Merry. It allows users to quickly identify One Piece cards by taking a photo, with the image processing handled by the backend. The app provides detailed card information and also enables users to build their own vault of cards and test deck builds. It connects seamlessly to the Merry server, offering a smooth experience for card recognition, exploration, and deck management.
projects.name: Nomi Nomi

projects.description: The ope-ope project leverages Google's Gemini API for text extraction from images, a crucial step in recognizing One Piece game cards. It then applies Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques to interpret the extracted text and search for matching cards in a database. This combination of Gemini for visual extraction and NLP for text processing enables quick and accurate card identification, providing users with detailed information efficiently.
